result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marion Larue Pattillo

Defendant Marion Larue Pattillo not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court for Marion Larue Pattillo.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/7/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires: 12/8/22

Defendant Marion Larue Pattillo not in court, in custody.  Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court for Marion Larue Pattillo.  Attorney Mallory R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests an adjournment of the jury trial on 10/10/22. State does not object. Court GRANTS request and sets matter for a final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
to reschedule jury trial, filed.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Marion Larue Pattillo not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Jury Trial. Defendant not produced. Court is in trial on another matter and unable to hear case. Case adjourned for Final Pre-Trial and Jury Tria dates, Br 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for Jury Trial. Parties prepared to proceed. Court passes case to address court calendar.

Case heard by Judge Rosa, Branch 35 on behalf of Judge Kiefer, Branch 29:
Defendant Marion Larue Pattillo in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Marion Larue Pattillo in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea hearing. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Defendant does not consent to conducting plea via zoom. Case remains calendared in Branch 29.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Marion Larue Pattillo not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. State filed a joinder motion. Court GRANTS joinder in cases 20CF2243 and 22CF1330. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 7/18/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
for joinder, filed.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Marion Larue Pattillo not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a final pre-trial. Parties request an adjourned final pre-trial.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski in court, defendant Marion Larue Pattillo not in court, in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR.29
Defendant Marion Larue Pattillo in custody, appears in court with Attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Mallory R. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Detective Z. Thoms. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Marion Larue Pattillo in court with attorney John Thaddeus Wasielewski.  Defendant Marion Larue Pattillo in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary heaering.   States witness is not present.  Defense moves to dismiss.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
received and filed.

to adjourn preliminary hearing, filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,000.00.  If alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Marion Larue Pattillo in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Marion Larue Pattillo in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
